list.s: Muskrats, according to my encyclopedia, look like giant rats, are found in and around the mudbanks bordering marshes and quiet ponds, have partially webbed feet, and do a good deal of swimming.

s.comment: "keep quiet" is a phrase meaning to remain silent

list.s: Today's Papers doesn't care whether the NYT just missed the story, or was misled by its government sources as part of a cover and deception plan, or like a congressional leader, was let in on the deal with the promise to keep quiet until afterwards.

s.comment: sense 3 is the best fit, though none of the definitions quite match

list.s: The NYT piece frames this as do-nothing action, designed to temporarily quiet demands coming simultaneously from the Israeli right-wing, Palestinians, and the U.S. (which is pressing Netanyahu to cede land quickly).
Later, we shared a quiet bottle of Laphroaig with this well-mannered and impeccably spoken paragon and his beautiful young wife.

s.comment: "keep quiet' means to remian silent or prevent from talking

list.s: To keep Betsy and Arlene quiet about having seen G. Gordon Liddy (Harry Shearer) at both the Watergate and the White House, Nixon (Dan Hedaya) made them "Official White House Dog Walkers"--in which capacity they stumbled on a room full of people shredding documents and counting piles of payoff money.
In a year of spectacular emotion, his was a quiet triumph.
If ever asked to explain one of her rare periods of quiet, she would reply, Still waters run deep.

s.comment: it is difficult to discern the appropriate sense from this context, but sense 3 seems possible

list.s: I find it a gentle, thrilling, quiet, and transforming vision.

Brodkey's account takes us from his discovery that he was ill with AIDS through his prolonged hospital stay with pneumonia, his decision to return home, and the slow months--many in a quiet equilibrium that was not health, but not death either--that followed.
On the road north, a right fork at Culik leads eastwards to Amed, a quiet fishing and salt-panning village spread out along several kilometers of beaches.
